news.title: Highlanders dismiss Kaindu after underwhelming first half of season
news.content:
Story by Mthokozisi Dube
BULAWAYO giants, Highlanders, have fired head coach Kelvin Kaindu after a string of poor results.
Highlanders have blown hot and cold during the first half of the season, managing ninth position with 23 points.

news.title: Dhlakama leaves Hwange Football Club returns to Green Fuel
news.content:
Story by Mthokozisi Dube
CHISUMBANJE – PREMIER Soccer League side Green Fuel has confirmed the reappointment of Rodwell Dhlakama as head coach, marking a dramatic return to the Chisumbanje-based club after a brief stint with Hwange Football Club.
In a statement issued on Monday, the club revealed that Dhlakama has been handed the reins with immediate effect.
His return sees Taurai Mangwiro, who had been leading the technical team, elevated to the position of Technical Director, while the rest of the coaching staff retains their current roles.

news.title: Defending Champions Simba Bhora prove their credentials for title defence
news.content:
Story by Anashe Murombedzi
CASTLE Lager Premier Soccer League defending champions, Simba Bhora, are proving they have the credentials to defend their title after returning to the top of the league table at the weekend.
A 1-nil win over Yadah, courtesy of a Blessing Moyo 57th-minute free-kick strike, has seen the Shamva-based side move to the top of the PSL log, dislodging MWOS.
They have now amassed 10 wins, five draws, and two losses, giving them a total of 35 points.
Simba Bhora look to have found consistency as the league reaches mid-season, setting their sights on defending their title.
The Shamva-based side dethroned MWOS, who suffered their first loss of the season.
MWOS are now a point behind Simba Bhora and can be a team to worry about as they are also proving to be a force to be reckoned with.
TelOne is showing up to be in the game, occupying third position with 28 points, while Scottland seals the top four with 27 points.
Ngezi Platinum is fifth with 25 points, followed by the trio of unbeaten FC Platinum, ZPC Kariba, and Herentals, all locked on 24 points each, sealing the top half of the league table.
Highlanders lead the bottom half with 23 points, followed by Manica Diamonds with 20.

news.title: Tarakinyu triumphs in Beitbridge half marathon as nation rallies behind drug-free society agenda
news.content:
Story by Providence Maraneli
BEITBRIDGE – VERERAN long-distance runner Moses Tarakinyu emerged victorious at the Run for Hope Half Marathon, an event held in honour of Vice President Colonel (Retired) Kembo Mohadi in Beitbridge this Saturday.
Representing Black Rhinos, Tarakinyu completed the 21-kilometre race in an impressive 1 hour, 7 minutes, and 45 seconds, narrowly fending off competition from his teammate Tatenda Hove, who crossed the finish line one second later.
Jonathan Chinyoka of ZPCS secured third position with a time of 1 hour and 48 seconds.
“I am delighted to have won this marathon. It forms an important part of my training for upcoming competitions. I’m grateful to the organisers for such opportunities which keep us focused and prepared,” Tarakinyu said.
The event attracted participants from across the country, with various categories including people with disabilities, the elderly, youth, and children.
Participants described the race as more than just a sporting event, but a powerful message in the fight against drug and substance abuse.
“This event is a reminder to us as the youth that we must take a stand against drug and substance abuse,” said one participant.
“We are so thankful to the Vice President for thinking of people with disabilities. I travelled from afar to participate, and I am proud to have come first in my category,” another added.
The event forms part of a broader national campaign to promote healthy lifestyles, unity, and social transformation.

news.title: ZPCS’ Commissioner General Goodwill Trust Fund golf tournament tees off in Vic Falls
news.content:
Story by Tichaona Kurewa
VICTORIA FALLS – THE 2025 Zimbabwe Prisons and Correctional Services (ZPCS) Commissioner General Goodwill Trust Fund Matabeleland North Golf Tournament teed off this Saturday morning at the Elephant Hills Golf Course in Victoria Falls.
Established in 2011, the Trust Fund aims to support the welfare of families of deceased officers as well as other vulnerable members of the community.
